subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 02 July, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Arsenal snap up striker Da Silva
Arsenal sign Croatian striker Eduardo da Silva from Dinamo Zagreb for a reported £16.25m.



 
Blackburn seal Rigters transfer
NAC Breda forward Maceo Rigters has signed a four-year deal with Blackburn Rovers.



 
Gudjohnsen cool on Newcastle link
Eidur Gudjohnsen is determined to fight for his place at Barcelona despite reports linking him with a £4.5m move to Newcastle.








GOLF




Controversy hits Open qualifying
Eight players are forced to replay the fourth hole in Open qualifying after the pin is repositioned at Sunningdale.



 
Kerr claims US Women's Open win
American Cristie Kerr claims her first major title with victory at the US Women's Open at Pine Needles.



 
Storm surges to French Open win
England's Graeme Storm clinches his maiden European Tour title with a one-shot victory in the French Open.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton makes Silverstone pledge
Lewis Hamilton believes McLaren can match Ferrari at next weekend's British Grand Prix despite coming third at Magny-Cours.



 
Button eyes further improvement
Jenson Button says he can see light at the end of the tunnel after securing his first point of the year at the French Grand Prix.



 
Ferrari revival thwarts Hamilton
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen and Felipe Massa finish first and second in the French Grand Prix to end Lewis Hamilton's run of victories.








FORMULA ONE

ATHLETICS




Pavey qualifies for World Champs
Britain's Jo Pavey qualifies for the World Championships after beating the 10,000 metres qualifying time in Watford.



 
Super Weir claims two world bests
Wheelchair racer David Weir sets two new world records in the 1500 and 5,000m in Atlanta.



 
Wanjiru gets set for Tyneside run
World half marathon record holder Sammy Wanjiru is confirmed as a participant in this year's Great North Run.








CYCLING




Vinokourov defends Ferrari link
Tour de France favourite Alexander Vinokourov insists he has nothing to hide about his relationship with trainer Dr Michele Ferrari.



 
Thousands tackle 'Le Tour' route
Up to 5,000 riders are cycling the Tour de France route through London and Kent.



 
Brit Cavendish claims Tour spot
Britain's Mark Cavendish is named in T-Mobile's nine-man team for the Tour de France.








FUN AND GAMES




Strawberries and screams
Robbo suggests 'Hawk-ear' to calm Sharapova down



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport



 
Quotes of the Week
Thierry Henry is gunning for Barcelona, plus Jose Mourinho gets fruity
